net.rim.device.api.ui.component.table
Class RegionStyles

java.lang.Object
  net.rim.device.api.ui.component.table.RegionStyles

public class RegionStyles
extends Object

Container class for the region styles to be applied to a region.

Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

Field Summary
static int ALIGN_BOTTOM
          A vertical alignment behavior code indicating that the field in the region should be aligned to the bottom.
static int ALIGN_CENTER
          A horizontal alignment behavior code indicating that the field in the region should be aligned to the center.
static int ALIGN_LEFT
          A horizontal alignment behavior code indicating that the field in the region should be aligned to the left.
static int ALIGN_MIDDLE
          A vertical alignment behavior code indicating that the field in the region should be aligned to the middle.
static int ALIGN_RIGHT
          A horizontal alignment behavior code indicating that the field in the region should be aligned to the right.
static int ALIGN_TOP
          A vertical alignment behavior code indicating that the field in the region should be aligned to the top.
static int BEHAVIOR_FONT
          A behavior type that describes how the region obtains its font.
static int BEHAVIOR_HALIGN
          A behavior type that describes how the field in the region will be horizontally aligned.
static int BEHAVIOR_LAYOUT
          A behavior type that describes the layout of the field that will be housed in this region.
static int BEHAVIOR_VALIGN
          A behavior type that describes how the field in the region will be vertically aligned.
static int FONT_FOLLOW_SPECIFIED
          A font behavior code indicating that the region's font should be the one specified in the RegionStyles constructor or via the setFont() method.
static int FONT_FOLLOW_THEME
          A font behavior code indicating that the region's font should be specified by the current theme.
static int FONT_FOLLOW_USER
          A font behavior code indicating that the region's font should be specified by the current user-specified font.
static int LAYOUT_DYNAMIC
          A layout behavior code indicating that the field will need several re-layouts throughout its lifetime on screen.
static int LAYOUT_STATIC
          A layout behavior code indicating that the field will only need to be laid out once in the table.

Field Detail

BEHAVIOR_FONT

public static final int BEHAVIOR_FONT
A behavior type that describes how the region obtains its font. Under this category, the following behaviors are defined: RegionStyles.FONT_FOLLOW_SPECIFIED, RegionStyles.FONT_FOLLOW_THEME and RegionStyles.FONT_FOLLOW_USER.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

BEHAVIOR_HALIGN

public static final int BEHAVIOR_HALIGN
A behavior type that describes how the field in the region will be horizontally aligned. Under this category, the following behaviors are defined: RegionStyles.ALIGN_LEFT, RegionStyles.ALIGN_RIGHT and RegionStyles.ALIGN_CENTER.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

BEHAVIOR_VALIGN

public static final int BEHAVIOR_VALIGN
A behavior type that describes how the field in the region will be vertically aligned. Under this category, the following behaviors are defined: RegionStyles.ALIGN_TOP, RegionStyles.ALIGN_BOTTOM and RegionStyles.ALIGN_MIDDLE.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

BEHAVIOR_LAYOUT

public static final int BEHAVIOR_LAYOUT
A behavior type that describes the layout of the field that will be housed in this region. Under this category, the following behaviors are defined: LAYOUT_STATIC and LAYOUT_DYNAMIC.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

LAYOUT_STATIC

public static final int LAYOUT_STATIC
A layout behavior code indicating that the field will only need to be laid out once in the table. This is the default behavior, unless otherwise stated using RegionStyles.setBehavior(int,int).

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

LAYOUT_DYNAMIC

public static final int LAYOUT_DYNAMIC
A layout behavior code indicating that the field will need several re-layouts throughout its lifetime on screen. An example of this behavior is ChoiceField, where the shape of the choice box changes with each choice.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

A horizontal alignment behavior code indicating that the field in the region should be aligned to the left.

FONT_FOLLOW_THEME

public static final int FONT_FOLLOW_THEME
A font behavior code indicating that the region's font should be specified by the current theme.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

FONT_FOLLOW_USER

public static final int FONT_FOLLOW_USER
A font behavior code indicating that the region's font should be specified by the current user-specified font.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

FONT_FOLLOW_SPECIFIED

public static final int FONT_FOLLOW_SPECIFIED
A font behavior code indicating that the region's font should be the one specified in the RegionStyles constructor or via the setFont() method.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0


Constructor Detail

RegionStyles

public RegionStyles(Border border,
                    Font font,
                    XYEdges margin,
                    XYEdges padding,
                    int horizontalAlignment,
                    int verticalAlignment)
Creates an instance of a RegionStyles object that will later correspond to a Data Template region.

Parameters:
border - A Border object that will describe a border around the region. Setting this to null will trigger the application of the cell border settings from the currently active theme.
font - The font that will be active in the region. Setting this to null will the trigger the application of the cell font settings from the currently active theme.
margin - The margin assignments for the region.
padding - The padding assignments for the region. Setting this to null will trigger the application of the cell padding settings from the currently active theme.
horizontalAlignment - The horizontal alignment for the region. Should be one of: RegionStyles.ALIGN_LEFT, RegionStyles.ALIGN_RIGHT, RegionStyles.ALIGN_CENTER The default horizontalAlignment is RegionStyles.ALIGN_LEFT
verticalAlignment - The vertical alignment for the region. Should be one of: RegionStyles.ALIGN_TOP, RegionStyles.ALIGN_BOTTOM, RegionStyles.ALIGN_MIDDLE The default verticalAlignment is RegionStyles.ALIGN_TOP
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0


Method Detail

getBorder

public Border getBorder()
Get the border that has been applied to this region.

Returns:
the current border for the region
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

setBorder

public void setBorder(Border border)
Set the border for this region.

Parameters:
border - the new border for this region
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

getFont

public Font getFont()
Get the font that has been applied to this region.

Returns:
the current font for the region.
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

setFont

public void setFont(Font font)
Specifies a font for this region. This automatically changes the font behavior to RegionStyles.FONT_FOLLOW_SPECIFIED

Parameters:
font - the new font for this region
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

setBehavior

public void setBehavior(int behaviorType,
                        int behavior)
Sets one of the behavior types for this region.

Parameters:
behaviorType - An integer specifying the type of behavior being modified.
behavior - An integer specifying the desired behavior code under the specified behavior type. Note that currently there are three behavior types defined:RegionStyles.BEHAVIOR_FONT, BEHAVIOR_VALIGN, BEHAVIOR_HALIGN. Under the RegionStyles.BEHAVIOR_FONT category, the following behaviors are defined: RegionStyles.FONT_FOLLOW_SPECIFIED, RegionStyles.FONT_FOLLOW_THEME and RegionStyles.FONT_FOLLOW_USER. Under the RegionStyles.BEHAVIOR_VALIGN category, the following behaviors are defined: RegionStyles.ALIGN_TOP, RegionStyles.ALIGN_BOTTOM, RegionStyles.ALIGN_MIDDLE. Under the RegionStyles.BEHAVIOR_HALIGN category, the following behaviors are defined: RegionStyles.ALIGN_LEFT, RegionStyles.ALIGN_RIGHT, RegionStyles.ALIGN_CENTER. If an invalid behavior type is defined, no action will be performed. If an invalid behavior is defined, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

getBehavior

public int getBehavior(int behaviorType)
Gets the current setting of a particular behavior type for this region.

Parameters:
behaviorType - An integer describing the type of behavior being modified.
Returns:
An integer describing the current behavior of the specified behavior type. Note that currently there is only one behavior type known as RegionStyles.BEHAVIOR_FONT. Under the RegionStyles.BEHAVIOR_FONT category, the following behaviors are defined: RegionStyles.FONT_FOLLOW_SPECIFIED, RegionStyles.FONT_FOLLOW_THEME and RegionStyles.FONT_FOLLOW_USER. If an invalid type is detected, a value of -1 will be returned.
Since:
BlackBerry API 7.0.0

getHorizontalAlignment

public int getHorizontalAlignment()
A convenience method to get the horizontal alignment that has been applied to this region. RegionStyles.getBehavior(int behaviorType)

Returns:
the current horizontal alignment for the region
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

setHorizontalAlignment

public void setHorizontalAlignment(int horizontalAlignment)
A convenience method to set the horizontal alignment for this region. RegionStyles.setBehavior(int behaviorType, int behavior)

Parameters:
horizontalAlignment - the new horizontal alignment for this region
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if Horizontal Alignment is not one of the following: RegionStyles.ALIGN_LEFT, RegionStyles.ALIGN_RIGHT, RegionStyles.ALIGN_CENTER
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0

A convenience method to set the vertical alignment for this region. RegionStyles.setBehavior(int behaviorType, int behavior)

Parameters:
verticalAlignment - the new vertical alignment for this region
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if Horizontal Alignment is not one of the following: RegionStyles.ALIGN_TOP, RegionStyles.ALIGN_BOTTOM, RegionStyles.ALIGN_MIDDLE
Since:
BlackBerry API 6.0.0
